result.execSummary:
The defendant Tremaine Cortez Sifore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Case Called @ 1:12 PM: Defendant Tremaine Cortez Sifore in court.  Ruth Ann Zouski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes $543 remains owing with no payments since August of 2015.  Statement by Def as to nonpayment - he had forgot about fees and thought everything was being paid thru his probation.  Def is now cleared to go back to work medically - does not have the full balance to pay for release.  He is commencing employment and just rec'd word of his eviction.  The Court:  Finds basis exists for contempt - no payments on PP established.  30 days WCJ - Stayed - Purge:  Commencing on 5/1/17 and continuing without interruption until full paid must maintain $50/mo until fully paid.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:10 PM: Defendant Tremaine Cortez Sifore in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  SPD states matter if the Court will allow, resolution has been reached.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed.  Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing in its entirety. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing.  Def BOT.  INFO Filed - Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Terms of bifurcated SEH explained.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea (POT 2): NC   Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Statement by Def:  None offered.  The Court:  Accepts Resolution.  Def awaiting SEHR - S/W - 18 mos probation. Conditions:  AODA and any follow thru as recommended;  the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; Court Costs plus DNA Surcharge; DNA Sample to be provided if not already done so; Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department prior to returning to FDL Co Jail.  Appeal Rights Given.
